meanings.definition: A person or thing that eclipses.
meanings.sent1: The talented singer was an eclipsers on the stage, outshining all others.
meanings.sent2: The new skyscraper became the eclipsers of the city skyline.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel thought he was the eclipsers of the forest, gathering all the attention.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter was an eclipsers, brightening up the room like the sun.
meanings.sent5: The majestic mountain stood as an eclipsers, casting a shadow over the valley.

meanings.definition: A celestial body that causes an eclipse.
meanings.sent1: During the solar eclipse, the moon is the eclipsers that blocks the sun's light.
meanings.sent2: The astronomers studied the eclipsers to understand the phenomenon of eclipses.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cloud played the role of an eclipsers, hiding the moon during the lunar eclipse.
meanings.sent4: The giant planet acted as an eclipsers, creating a stunning eclipse in the galaxy.
meanings.sent5: The Earth is sometimes the eclipsers, coming between the sun and the moon to create an eclipse.

meanings.definition: A device used to create an eclipse effect in photography.
meanings.sent1: The photographer used a special lens as an eclipsers to capture the eclipse effect in the photo.
meanings.sent2: The camera attachment acted as the eclipsers, producing a beautiful eclipse image.
meanings.sent3: The lens filter pretended to be an eclipsers, creating a fake eclipse in the picture.
meanings.sent4: The photography gadget served as an eclipsers, adding a unique eclipse touch to the photograph.
meanings.sent5: The equipment functioned as an eclipsers, enhancing the eclipse effect in the image.
